summary: This document is an email chain from August 31, 2020, referencing a forwarded email from July 12, 2019. The 2019 email is from an Assistant State Attorney in Palm Beach County's Special Victim's Unit, soliciting information about victims of Jeffrey Epstein for potential criminal charges related to crimes in Palm Beach County. The 2020 email exchange appears to be confirming the identity of a contact.

persons.name: Marti Rex
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) on the July 12, 2019 email from the Assistant State Attorney regarding information on Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: State Attorney's Office Inquiry
events.description: An Assistant State Attorney from Palm Beach County's Special Victim's Unit sends an email soliciting information about victims of Jeffrey Epstein to support potential criminal charges for crimes occurring in Palm Beach County.

keyFacts: The Office of the State Attorney for Palm Beach County was actively seeking information in July 2019 to build criminal charges against Jeffrey Epstein for crimes occurring in that county.
The inquiry specifically targeted the Special Victim's Unit, Human Trafficking and ICAC (Internet Crimes Against Children) divisions, indicating the nature of the potential charges.
The email chain shows communication about forwarding victim information to the State Attorney's office, suggesting an ongoing effort to identify victims.
The document includes a standard legal disclaimer about attorney-client privilege and confidentiality, and a Florida public records law notice.
The primary sender and recipient names in the email headers are redacted or omitted from the provided text.
